snippet: A new stage in a power struggle has resulted in rival centers of government, one in Tripoli, and the other in Tobruk.
abstract: Libyan government says it has lost control of its ministries, government buildings and public headquarters to coalition of militias that had taken over Tripoli, another milestone in disintegration of the state.

byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Zway contributed reporting from Tripoli, Libya.

lead_paragraph: A new stage in a power struggle has resulted in rival centers of government, one in Tripoli, and the other in Tobruk.

headline.main: Libyan Militias Seize Control of Capital as Chaos Rises
headline.print_headline: Libyan Militias Seize Control of Capital as Chaos Rises
